participants: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: Hi team :wave: working on a few questions for BofA and wondering if it's possible to write a UDF or add some config logic to map records based on if a barcode is found on the page. For example, if barcode is found on a page, this is 1 record.  (cc: @Jonathan Shih )
I'll look into this and see what I can do

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: I'm just wondering if this is generally possible to create.. not if we can do it right now through a preexisting UDF.
I see. Yeah let me take a look and see if we are actually storing the required info
Btw @georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire do you have some examples of docs with barcodes?

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: Not right now - this is a question that came up from a demo Anant gave to BofA. The exact question is: "Can IB identify Bar codes? Would IB be able to separate documents using bar codes?"

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: I haven't talked with this person before but this question came out of the demo so trying to give them an answer and then can meet with them to learn more.

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message:
For the first question I have this answer:
• Using Instabase’s Refiner v5 tool, you can extract the image of a barcode when provided the expected barcode region.

Yes refiner can definitely be used for this. I just wanted to make sure that we have access to the barcodes extracted by Abbyy, so we might be able to get them earlier on. @Chetan do you know anything about this?
I don’t believe barcodes have been ported to refiner-v5 (@Erick can you confirm)?
I’m also not sure how well the “barcode find” works, but our barcode decode (assuming common formats) works pretty well

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: @Chetan are there any docs on this?
I can easily add a udf for qr. haven’t played too much with that feature though. We might even be able to auto detect too, in which case, this would be pretty straightforward
I can check this out around 10:30

Wow I misread this — barcodes are not a docops thing (mistook for qr codes). @Aaron Tami seems to have created a bunch of those commits.

I’ve never used it, and it seems like you can just add a process files config of `"detect_barcodes": true`  and you could use that in some kind of map records script.

*As for decoding the barcode contents in refiner 5 — that is definitely something we don’t support at the moment*, and depending how that `detect_barcodes` flag works, it would be pretty easy to make a UDF that just extracts any barcodes that mostly overlap with the annotated box. However, you can definitely extract an _image_ of it as @georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire said
ya barcodes are supported in OCR< only with Abbyy, and not all types of barcodes
the udf can just check if any barcodes are present on the ibocr
